nodes.title: Article S13
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the administrative procedure for registering sports federations, national organizations, and clubs. It specifies where application files must be submitted, the composition and role of a ministerial review commission, the timeline for the commission's conclusions, and the final ministerial steps for granting legal personality.

nodes.title: Article S15
nodes.summary: This partial document contains the final provisions (Art. 13-16) of an official order ("arrêté"). The main points covered are: the abrogation of prior contradictory regulations (Art. 13); the obligation for sports federations, associations, leisure clubs, and NGOs to comply with the referenced law and this order within three months of its signature, publication, or notification (Art. 14); the instruction for the directors of physical/sporting activities and leisure services to widely disseminate the order within 30 days (Art. 15); and the stipulation that the order takes effect from the date of its signature (Art. 16). The text also includes a disclaimer stating that the site is under construction and that the texts are provided by associations without assuming responsibility.

nodes.title: Article S3
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the legal prerequisites for obtaining provisional operating authorization for sports organizations in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It covers three main types of entities: national sports federations (Article 1, with 10 specific conditions), sports associations or clubs (Article 2, with 9 conditions), and associations of professional bodies contributing to sports (like coaches, referees, medical staff) (Articles 3 & 4, listing general requirements). The conditions focus on national structure, development programs, legal compliance, internal regulations, representation, anti-discrimination, and adherence to the national sports legal framework.

nodes.title: Article S7
nodes.summary: This partial document outlines the legal prerequisites for leisure associations and clubs to obtain a provisional operating authorization. It specifies that these entities must meet most of the general conditions from earlier articles, with specific exceptions listed. Additional mandatory requirements include presenting a funded activity program, establishing an internal dispute resolution mechanism, committing to comply with relevant laws and taxes, and ensuring representation of participants and organizers in their governance.

nodes.title: Article S9
nodes.summary: The partial document outlines the prerequisites for obtaining provisional operational authorization for a non-governmental organization (NGO). The four main requirements are: presenting short, medium, and long-term activity and development programs; committing to comply with legal and regulatory texts governing physical, sports, and leisure activities; presenting its internal regulations; and prohibiting all discrimination based on philosophy, race, sex, or religion.
